name: Guess / Appearance / Hearsay
description: Grammar patterns used to express uncertainty, visual impressions, indirect evidence, or reported information.

entries.meaning: seems like / looks like (casual, subjective impression)
entries.example_ja: あの人は先生みたいです。
entries.example_en: That person seems like a teacher.

entries.meaning: apparently / I heard that / typical of (based on info or reputation)
entries.example_ja: 彼は来ないらしいです。

entries.example_en: It looks like it’s going to rain.

entries.meaning: I heard that / it is said that (reported information)
entries.example_ja: 明日は寒くなるそうです。
entries.example_en: I heard that it will be cold tomorrow.

entries.meaning: it seems that / it appears that (reasoned or indirect evidence)
